Detailed Description

Describes one node on one street segment.

Including a list with all connections that leads from this node. A node is one of the endpoints of a StreetSegmentItem (is the street segment not i a stright line from node 0 to node 1 it might have graphical points in between, but these are not nodes and described by the GfxData for the StreetSegmentItem). The connections that are used when traversing the map is always between two Nodes.

A node have membervariables that is valid for the streetsegment when entering the road at that node (e.g. entry restrictions or level).

Definition at line 44 of file Node.h.

Connection* Node::getEntryConnectionFrom (  uint32  fromNode  )  const
 

Get the connection that leads to this node coming from the specified node id.

If no such connection is found, NULL is returned.

Parameters:
fromNode The node id that the connection is coming from.
Returns:
The connection coming from fromNode if such a connection is present. Otherwise NULL.

uint32 Node::getNodeID (   )  const [inline]
 

Get the ID of this node.

The ID is the same as the ID for the Street Segment where this node is located except the MSB (that is 1 if this is node 1, 0 otherwise).

Returns:
The id of this node

int8 Node::m_level [protected]
 

Level of node relative groundlevel.

  1. ...; below ground
  2. -1; below ground
  3. 0; on ground
  4. 1; above ground
  5. ...; above ground

uint32 Node::m_nodeID [protected]
 

The id of this node.

The first bit indicates if this is node 0 or 1 in the StreetSegmentItem with id nodeID & 0x7FFFFFFF.
